channel.title: Half Life, Plagiarism?
channel.description: I noticed, headcrabs look and act very similar(attach to head) to the alien babies from Alien. Alien was made before Half Life. Could this be plagiarism? Is there any other ideas that could have been stolen? Discuss, bitches.

item.title: Half Life, Plagiarism?
item.dc:creator: Mented
item.description:
Area 51.
The Mist.
Facehuggers.

You know what? I think I’l let them off.

Read full topic

item.title: Half Life, Plagiarism?
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
nietzschesaurus:

Dear god, this thread is hurting my brain. Alright guys, look. It’s a science fiction story. There are idea you can use that are free game. space travel, aliens, teleportation, government conspiracies, strange fucked-up tentacle monsters, scientists that get slaughtered en masse, strange weaponry, anti-gravity machinery, super-powered techno suits, plasma guns, otherworldly godlike beings. These things are all typical sci-fi fare, and they’re all in Half-Life. Original ideas typically don’t come out of the blue; they’re ideas built upon other ideas. You would know this if you’ve ever come up with something of worth.

The headcrab was invented by Ted Backman, who has admitted “his inspirations for the Half-Life creatures was H.R. Giger’s Necronomicon paintings and its sexual innuendos” (sauce). That doesn’t mean he COPIED!!!111!1~1!3243~! H.R. Giger. If you’ll notice, the headcrab and the facehugger have two things in common: jumping and claws. That’s it. This man did not look at the facehugger and say “LET’S USE THAT BUT MAKE IT DIFFERENT BSRLKJDASDF!” That is retarded. He is an extremely talented artist and it’s an insult to artists everywhere to assume that simply because something has a vague, superficial resemblance to something else that it must be a direct rip-off. This is something that annoys me greatly about the internet.

Half-Life is one of the most original games in decades. These guys busted their asses creating a game that was unlike any other game at the time, in both gameplay/mechanics and storyline. Of course they were inspired by other works. Of course they paid tribute to other things. This is not wrong. Nor is it illegal. Is the Madonna and Child any less a work of art simply because it’s a painting of the virgin Mary? OBVIOUSLY MICHAELANGELO WAS RIPPING OFF DA VINCI’S THE VIRGIN IN THE ROCKS DURRRR.

I don’t mean to offend anyone, and this isn’t a direct attack on anyone in particular. I just get rather zealous about things sometimes. You understand.

Someone give this man a medal.

Read full topic

This. If you disagree, please google “intertextuality”.

item.title: Half Life, Plagiarism?
item.dc:creator: madkat
item.description:
I’m fairly sure DOOM had health kits, but they may even have been stolen from the sick bay aboard the Enterprise :-/

– edit –
Also, DOOM had armour that was bought cheap from an army surplus store. But at least they paid for it - everyone else just stole it out of DOOM.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: Pheonix_Wright
item.description:
MarshmallowRadiation:

I think they had something like that in System Shock (1 or 2, I can’t remember)

they did in 2…though there was no real simulation of gravity it moved stuff in straight lines and dropped when it was done… no momentum at all.

Read full topic

item.title: Half Life, Plagiarism?
item.dc:creator: GilCMassey
item.description:
Really? Why would they be different? I have been to both places and they looks similar. I hiked through both of them. Black Mesa had a little more grass, but that was pretty much it. It didn’t even really look like the area where it is in the game.

Read full topic

item.title: Half Life, Plagiarism?
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
Black Mesa has more in common with the Montauk Project conspiracies than Area 51, while Area 51’s location is a more popular and identifiable one. And the out door areas would be radically different.

Read full topic

I have nothing else to add to this thread.:3

item.title: Half Life, Plagiarism?
item.dc:creator: GilCMassey
item.description:
xalener:

That’s what they want you to think, man.

…so it IS a strip bar? I knew they were lying to me from day one…

It would really suck if Black Mesa was actually Black Mesa. Then one day, we are gonna go to Hell cuz a guy in a metal suit was tricked into pushing a potentially dangerous item into an electric beam.

Then I would have to join the Resistance. 20 years from now.

Read full topic

item.title: Half Life, Plagiarism?
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
That’s what they want you to think, man.

Read full topic

item.title: Half Life, Plagiarism?
item.dc:creator: GilCMassey
item.description:
even the location hints at it. Area 51 is located in New Mexico. Black Mesa is a real place (not the labs lol) and is very close to where Area 51 is supposed to be. Area 51 is actually just a Air Force Base.

Read full topic

item.title: Half Life, Plagiarism?
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
Pretty much. A number of things in HL seems to reference government conspiracy stories. Intentionally or otherwise.
